## [[Layouts]{.layout .Bigger}](https://quarto.org/docs/output-formats/page-layout.html) 

:::{.panel-tabset}

### [Overview]{.Smallest}

::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="80%" .Smaller}

```{r}
#|echo: false

try <- data.frame(method = c("`{.columns}`", "`{.grid}`", "`{layout=}`",  "`{lay-ncol}`"),
                  html = c("{{< iconify streamline-ultimate-color:check >}}", "{{< iconify streamline-ultimate-color:check >}}", "{{< iconify streamline-ultimate-color:check >}}", "{{< iconify streamline-ultimate-color:check >}}"),
                  typst = c("{{< iconify streamline-ultimate-color:delete-2 >}}", "{{< iconify streamline-ultimate-color:delete-2 >}}", "{{< iconify streamline-ultimate-color:check >}}",  "{{< iconify streamline-ultimate-color:check >}}"),
                  pdf = c("{{< iconify streamline-ultimate-color:delete-2 >}}", "{{< iconify streamline-ultimate-color:delete-2 >}}", "{{< iconify streamline-ultimate-color:check >}}*", "{{< iconify streamline-ultimate-color:check >}}*"))

library(kableExtra)

knitr::kable(try, escape=FALSE,    
    col.names=c("",   
                "html",
                "typst",
                "pdf"))
```

:::

::: {.column width="20%"}

::: {.callout-important}

Currently running Quarto version 1.8.26    

:::

:::

### [`{.columns}`]{.Smallest}

```{r}
#| echo: true
#| eval: false
---
title: "Untitled"
format: html
---

::: {.columns}                #<1>
::: {.column width="50%"}     #<2>
Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To a learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
Whatever else you'd like here
:::                       #<2>
:::                       #<3>

  
  
#  
```
1. opening fence {{< iconify maki:fence >}} [creating column container](https://quarto.org/docs/presentations/revealjs/#multiple-columns) 
2. column specifications using `width` attributes
3. closing fence {{< iconify maki:fence >}} for `.columns` container

### [`{.grid}`]{.Smallest}

::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="50%"}

```{r}
#| echo: true
#| eval: false

::: {.grid}                 #<1>
::: {.g-col-6}
## First column 
I would like to have text here
:::
  
::: {.g-col-6}
## Second column 
and here
More text
:::
:::                        #<2>
```
1. open the fence {{< iconify maki:fence >}} -- same scripting structure as `{.columns}` 
2. close the fence {{< iconify maki:fence >}} -- again same scripting structure as `{.columns}` 

:::

::: {.column width = "50%"}

::: {.callout-note}

### uh... about that... {{< iconify noto:disguised-face size=2x >}}

[Kinda works](https://quarto.org/docs/output-formats/page-layout.html#css-grid) (html only) but seemingly not intended to be a "go to" solution for isolated document bits -- more useful for page dimensions (sidebar, margin, etc) & [specified within YAML](https://quarto.org/docs/output-formats/page-layout.html#grid-customization)

:::

:::

:::

### [`{layout=}`]{.Smallest}

::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="60%"}

````{r}
#| echo: true
#| eval: false

::: {layout="[50,50]"}      #<1>

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:


```{r}         
1 + 1          
```

:::
````
1. currently "works" up to at least 5 columns (some online resources claim 2 or 3 column limitation)

:::

::: {.column width = "40%"}

::: {.callout-note}

### Yeahbut *

1. no gutter in {{< iconify vscode-icons:file-type-pdf2 >}} rendering  
2. ignores `echo`ed content [across all 3 document types]{.underline}
3. can do both [rows and columns](https://quarto.org/docs/authoring/figures.html#complex-layouts) -- ***vertical spacing is meaningful!!!***

:::

:::

:::

### [`{layout-ncol}`]{.Smallest}

::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="60%"}

```{r}
#| echo: true
#| eval: false
::: {layout-ncol=3}           #<1>
- Apples
- Oranges
- Bananas
- Grapes
- Kiwis
- Mangoes

A normal paragraph that will take up one entire column.

code or other info here
:::                       #<2>
```
1. open zee fence she too hot!! {{< iconify emojione-v1:hot-pepper >}}
2. close zee fence she too cold!! {{< iconify noto:cold-face >}}

:::

::: {.column width="40%"}

::: {.callout-note}

### Also *

1. operates same as `{layout=}` (vertical spaces determine column breaks)  
2. columns will be equal width 
3. see also [`{layout-nrow}`](https://quarto.org/docs/authoring/figures.html#multiple-rows)

:::

:::
